intro: Haplophyllum linifolium var. subglaucum, commonly known as the glaucous haplophyllum, is a succulent plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The leaves are typically blue-green in color due to a waxy coating that reduces water loss. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, often during the warmer months. It is well adapted to harsh environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
